p: Kevij et al. [ 75] came across a different behavior; in their study, the release of curcumin from whey protein isolate films was faster and higher with the fatty food simulant (95% ethanol, fatty simulant medium) than with the semi-fatty food simulant (50% ethanol, semi-food simulant medium). This behavior is explained by the lipophilic nature and better solubility of curcumin in 95% ethanol [ 75]. It is known that, in addition to the chemical composition of the active compounds and the conditions of the surrounding environment [ 75, 81], the polymerâ€“active compound interactions and the structure of the film matrix also influence the release of active compounds from biopolymer films.
